SEARCH
Package pl.polsl.lab.asser.moustafa.controller

Class Loader

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab.asser.moustafa.controller.Loader
public class Loader extends Object
Class that uses the Class Model and the Class View objects and has all the communication functions between the MVC pattern classes.

It has 3 different workflows depending on the mode of operation of the current application run:

  • help() : when the user provides only one argument, it uses the Class View object to print help on the console to explain to the user what arguments are needed.
  • runWithoutArgs() : when there are no arguments provided and the program should prompt the user to enter a number.
  • runWithTwoArgs() : when the user provides the correct number of arguments which is 2.
Version:
1.0
Author:
asser.elfeki

  • Method Details

    • help

      public void help()
      Uses the Class View object to print a guide on how to use the application and what arguments to provide

    • runWithoutArgs

      public void runWithoutArgs()
      Contains the algorithm used when no arguments are provided in the command line.

      Uses methods from both the model and the view to:

      • prompt the user to enter an input number.
      • validate it.
      • handle exceptions.

    • runWithTwoArgs

      public void runWithTwoArgs(String[] args) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Contains the algorithm used when 2 arguments are provided in the command line.
      Parameters:
      args - is the list of String arguments provided by the user in the command line
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in 2 cases:
      • direction of conversion is set to Arabic to Roman but the entered input is a non-numeric value.
      • direction of conversion is set to Roman to Arabic but the entered input is or contains non-Roman characters.IllegalArgumentException.

    • logException

      public void logException(String message)
      uses the Class View methods to log Exception messages to the console.
      Parameters:
      message - is the String message of a specific exception.

    • getOutput

      public void getOutput()
      Checks if output exists then uses the Class View method outputConvertedNumber(String output) to display it on the console.
